questions.question_text:
The electrochemical cell shown below is a concentration cell. M | M2+ (saturated solution of a sparingly soluble salt, MX2) || M2+ (0.001 mol dm–3) | M The emf of the cell depends on the difference in concentrations of M2+ ions at the two electrodes. The emf of the cell at 298 K is 0.059 V. 


The value of ∆G (kJ mol–1) for the given cell is (take 1F = 96500 C mol–1)

questions.question_text:
The electrochemical cell shown below is a concentration cell. M | M2+ (saturated solution of a sparingly soluble salt, MX2) || M2+ (0.001 mol dm–3) | M The emf of the cell depends on the difference in concentrations of M2+ ions at the two electrodes. The emf of the cell at 298 K is 0.059 V. 


The solubility product (Ksp; mol3 dm–9) of MX2 at 298 K based on the information available for the given concentration cell is (take 2.303 $$\times$$ R $$\times$$ 298/F = 0.059 V)

questions.question_text: For the given aqueous reactions, which of the statement(s) is(are) true?

option_texts.A: The first reaction is a redox reaction.
option_texts.C: Addition of filtrate to starch solution gives blue colour.
option_texts.D: White precipitate is soluble in NaOH solution.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: With reference to the scheme given, which of the given statement(s) about T, U, V and W is(are) correct?

option_texts.A: T is soluble in hot aqueous NaOH.
option_texts.C: Molecular formula of W is C_{10}H_{18}O_{4}.
option_texts.D: V gives effervescence on treatment with aqueous NaHCO_{3}.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Which of the given statement(s) about N, O, P and Q with respect to M is(are) correct?

option_texts.A: M and N are non-minor image stereoisomers.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: With respect to graphite and diamond, which of the statement(s) given below is(are) correct?

option_texts.B: Graphite has higher electrical conductivity than diamond.
option_texts.C: Graphite has higher thermal conductivity than diamond.
option_texts.D: Graphite has higher C-C bond order than diamond.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The given graphs/data I, II, III and IV represent general trends observed for different physisorption and chemisorption processes under mild conditions of temperature and pressure. Which of the following choice(s) about I, II, III and IV is(are) correct?

option_texts.A: I is physisorption and II is chemisorption.
option_texts.B: I is physisorption and III is chemisorption.
option_texts.C: IV is chemisorption and II is chemisorption.
option_texts.D: IV is chemisorption and III is chemisorption.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let $$f\left( x \right) = {\left( {1 - x} \right)^2}\,\,{\sin ^2}\,\,x + {x^2}$$ for all $$x \in IR$$ and let 

$$g\left( x \right) = \int\limits_1^x {\left( {{{2\left( {t - 1} \right)} \over {t + 1}} - In\,t} \right)f\left( t \right)dt} $$ for all $$x \in \left( {1,\,\infty } \right)$$.
Consider the statements:

$$P:$$ There exists some $$x \in R$$ such that $$f\left( x \right) + 2x = 2\left( {1 + {x^2}} \right)$$

$$Q:\,\,$$  There exists some $$x \in R$$ such that $$2\,f\left( x \right) + 1 = 2x\left( {1 + x} \right)$$ 

Then

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let $$f\left( x \right) = {\left( {1 - x} \right)^2}\,\,{\sin ^2}\,\,x + {x^2}$$ for all $$x \in IR$$ and let 

$$g\left( x \right) = \int\limits_1^x {\left( {{{2\left( {t - 1} \right)} \over {t + 1}} - In\,t} \right)f\left( t \right)dt} $$ for all $$x \in \left( {1,\,\infty } \right)$$.
Which of the following is true?

option_texts.C: $$g$$ is increasing on $$(1, 2)$$ and decreasing on $$\left( {2,\infty } \right)$$
option_texts.D: $$g$$ is decreasing on $$(1, 2)$$ and increasing on $$\left( {2,\infty } \right)$$

opposite directions with the same constant angular speed $$\omega $$. The
discs are in the same horizontal plane. At time t = 0, the points P
and Q are facing each other as shown in the figure. The relative
speed between the two points P and Q is vr. In one time period (T)
of rotation of the discs, vr as a function of time is best represented
by

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Six point charges are kept at the vertices of a regular hexagon of side $$L$$ and center $$O,$$ as shown in the figure. Given that $$K = {1 \over {4\pi {\varepsilon _0}}}{q \over {{L^2}}},$$ which of the following statement(s) is (are) correct ?

option_texts.A: The electric field at $$O$$ is $$6K$$ along $$OD$$
option_texts.C: The potential at all points on the line $$PR$$ is same
option_texts.D: The potential at all points on the line $$ST$$ is same

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
A student is performing the experiment of resonance Column. The diameter of the column tube is
4 cm. The frequency of the tuning fork is 512 Hz. The air temperature is 38oC in which the speed
of sound is 336 m/s. The zero of the meter scale coincides with the top end of the Resonance
Column tube. When the first resonance occurs, the reading of the water level in the column is

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Two moles of ideal helium gas are in a rubber balloon at 30oC. The balloon is fully expandable
and can be assumed to require no energy in its expansion. The temperature of the gas in the balloon is slowly changed to 35oC. The amount of heat required in raising the temperature is
nearly (take R = 8.31 J/mol.K)

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
A thin uniform cylindrical shell, closed at both ends, is partially filled with water. It is floating
vertically in water in half-submerged state. If $${\rho _c}$$ is the relative density of the material of the shell
with respect to water, then the correct statement is that the shell is

option_texts.A: more than half-filled if $${\rho _c}$$ is less than 0.5.
option_texts.B: more than half-filled if $${\rho _c}$$ is more than 1.0.
option_texts.D: less than half-filled if $${\rho _c}$$ is less than 0.5.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Two spherical planets P and Q have the same uniform density r, masses MP and MQ and surface
areas A and 4A respectively. A spherical planet R also has uniform density r and its mass is (MP
+ MQ). The escape velocities from the planets P, Q and R are VP, VQ and VR, respectively. Then

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
The figure shows a system consisting of (i) a ring of outer radius 3R rolling clockwise without
slipping on a horizontal surface with angular speed $$\omega $$ and (ii) an inner disc of radius 2R rotating
anti-clockwise with angular speed $${\omega  \over 2}$$. The ring and disc are separated by frictionless ball
bearings. The point P on the inner disc is at a distance R from the origin, where OP makes an
angle of $$30^\circ $$ with the horizontal. Then with respect to the horizontal surface,

option_texts.A: the point O has linear velocity $$3R\omega \widehat i$$
option_texts.B: the point P has linear velocity $${{11} \over 4}R\omega \widehat i + {{\sqrt 3 } \over 4}R\omega \widehat k$$
option_texts.C: the point P has linear velocity $${{13} \over 4}R\omega \widehat i - {{\sqrt 3 } \over 4}R\omega \widehat k$$
option_texts.D: the point P has linear velocity $$\left( {3 - {{\sqrt 3 } \over 4}} \right)R\omega \widehat i + {1 \over 4}R\omega \widehat k$$

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Two solid cylinders P and Q of same mass and same radius start rolling down a fixed inclined
plane from the same height at the same time. Cylinder P has most of its mass concentrated near
its surface, while Q has most of its mass concentrated near the axis. Which statement(s) is(are)
correct?

option_texts.A: Both cylinders P and Q reach the ground at the same time.
option_texts.B: Cylinders P has larger linear acceleration than cylinder Q.
option_texts.C: Both cylinders reach the ground with same translational kinetic energy.
option_texts.D: Cylinder Q reaches the ground with larger angular speed.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Consider a disc rotating in the horizontal plane with a constant angular speed $$\omega $$ about its centre
O. The disc has a shaded region on one side of the diameter and an unshaded region on the
other side as shown in the figure. When the disc is in the orientation as shown, two pebbles P
and Q are simultaneously projected at an angle towards R. The velocity of projection is in the y - z
plane and is same for both pebbles with respect to the disc. Assume that (i) they land back on
the disc before the disc has completed $${1 \over 8}$$ rotation, (ii) their range is less than half the disc radius,
and (iii) $$\omega $$ remains constant throughout. Then

option_texts.A: P lands in the shaded region and Q in the unshaded region.
option_texts.B: P lands in the unshaded region and Q in the shaded region.
option_texts.C: Both P and Q land in the unshaded region.
option_texts.D: Both P and Q land in the shaded region.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: An infinite long hollow conducting cylinder with inner radius R/2 and outer radius R carries a uniform current density along its length. The magnitude of the magnetic field, $$\left| {\overrightarrow B } \right|$$ as a function of the radial distance r from the axis is best represented by

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Which of the following statements about the instantaneous axis (passing through the centre of mass) is correct?

option_texts.A: It is vertical for both Cases (a) and (b).
option_texts.B: It is vertical for Case (a); and is at 45$$^\circ$$ to the xz-plane and lies in the plane of the disc for Case (b).
option_texts.C: It is horizontal for Case (a); and is 45$$^\circ$$ to the xz-plane and is normal to the plane of the disc for Case (b).
option_texts.D: It is vertical for Case (a); and is 45$$^\circ$$ to the xz-plane and is normal to the plane of the disc for Case (b).

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Which of the following statements regarding the angular speed about the instantaneous axis (passing through the centre of mass) is correct?

option_texts.B: It is $$\omega$$ for case (a); and $$\omega$$ / $$\sqrt2$$ for case (b).
option_texts.C: It is $$\omega$$ for case (a); and $$\sqrt2$$$$\omega$$ for case (b).

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: What is the maximum energy of the anti-neutrino?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: If the anti-neutrino had a mass of 3 eV/c2 (where c is the speed of light) instead of zero mass, what should be the range of the kinetic energy, K, of the electron?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: For light incident from air on a meta-material, the appropriate ray diagram is

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Choose the correct statement.

option_texts.A: The speed of light in the meta-material is v = c|n|.
option_texts.B: The speed of light in the meta-material is $$v = {c \over {|n|}}$$.
option_texts.C: The speed of light in the meta-material is v = c.
option_texts.D: The wavelength of the light in the meta-material ($$\lambda$$_{m}) is given by $${\lambda _m} = {\lambda _{air}}|n|$$, where $${\lambda _{air}}$$ is wavelength of the light in air.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: In the given circuit, the AC source has $$\omega$$ = 100 rad/s. Considering the inductor and capacitor to be ideal, the correct choice(s) is(are)

option_texts.A: The current through the circuit, I is 0.3 A.
option_texts.B: The current through the circuit, I is 0.3$$\sqrt2$$ A.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A current carrying infinitely long wire is kept along the diameter of a circular wire loop, without touching it, the correct statement(s) is(are)

option_texts.A: the emf induced in the loop is zero if the current is constant.
option_texts.B: the emf induced in the loop is finite if the current is constant.
option_texts.C: the emf induced in the loop is zero if the current decreases at a steady state
option_texts.D: the emf induced in the loop is finite if the current decreases at a steady state.
